text: 13.71 Part 1 of the policy seeks to ensure that new development does not increase the risk of flooding, and that development proposals work proactively to minimise and mitigate flood risk from all sources. Applicants are advised to seek early engagement with relevant stakeholders, including the council as the Lead Local Flood Authority, the Environment Agency, Thames Water, and Port of London Authority. For Part 1 (b), the vulnerability of uses is defined within the NPPF and is contained in the latest SFRA. 13.72 As per the Flood Risk and Coastal Change PPG: z highly vulnerable uses will not be permitted within flood zone 3a and 3b; z essential infrastructure and more vulnerable uses within flood zone 3a must pass the exception test; and z highly vulnerable uses within flood zone 2 must pass the exception test.
